description: Julie Krone suffered multiple fractures of the right ankle today during a violent spill on the final day of Saratoga's racing season and was not expected to ride again for the rest of this year and possibly longer.

title: Indoors And Out, A Big Show
description: David Letterman finally opened on Broadway last night, bringing much of his old NBC show with him to his new address: CBS and the Ed Sullivan Theater.

title: EASTERN ENTERPRISES SWAPS UNIT FOR U.S. FILTER STAKE
description: Eastern Enterprises of Weston, Mass., said yesterday that it had agreed to swap its Ionpure Technologies Corporation subsidiary for a 24 percent stake in the United States Filter Corporation. Under the terms of the agreement, Eastern would receive 2.25 million shares of United States Filter common stock and a small cash payment in exchange for the stake in United States Filter, a maker of water treatment equipment based in Palm Desert, Calif. The shares are worth about $50 million based on yesterday's closing price of $22.25 for United States Filter's common stock. Ionpure, with annual revenue of more than $55 million, provides water systems to commercial and industrial customers.

title: The President of Visa U.S.A. Resigns in a Surprise Move
description: In a surprise move, the president and chief executive of Visa U.S.A., H. Robert Heller, said yesterday that he had resigned from the credit card organization.

title: Bronx Boy, 10, Wounded By Gunmen on His Street
description: A 10-year-old boy, sitting with his older sister outside a restaurant across from his home in the Bronx, was hit in the head by a stray bullet on Sunday night when two gunmen opened fire in what was believed to be a drug-related shooting.

title: Dorian Corey Is Dead; A Drag Film Star, 56
description: Dorian Corey, a star of the documentary "Paris Is Burning," the award-winning film about female impersonators, died on Sunday at Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center in Manhattan. He was 56 and lived in Manhattan.

title: CHRONICLE
description: On the trail with MICHAEL JACKSON: The singer canceled a concert in Singapore yesterday after suffering a severe headache and vomiting as he prepared to go on stage. Mr. Jackson, who was not hospitalized, was taken back to his suite at the Raffles Hotel for an examination. The show was rescheduled for tomorrow.

title: Before We Set This Seagull Theory in Concrete
description: To the Editor:

title: Mark Isaacson, 38, Vendor and Expert On Decorative Arts
description: Mark Alan Isaacson, an expert on 20th-century decorative arts, died on Saturday at his home in Manhattan. He was 38.

title: Limited Inc. to Close and Scale Back Stores
description: The Limited Inc. has had enviable success building specialty-apparel chains -- so successful that the chains eventually began competing for the same customers.

title: Mellower Clinton Returns to White House
description: President Clinton returned to work today with a ruddy tan, an easy laugh and a mellow attitude that spilled over into a bit of Presidential meditation this morning at a White House prayer breakfast.

title: U.N. Aides in Somalia 'Captured' in Ranger Raid
description: Elite United States Army Rangers mounted their first major operation in Somalia today, storming several Mogadishu houses only to find one deserted and another full of United Nations workers whom they tied up and briefly detained, United Nations and Pentagon officials said.

title: Riding a Beat, Tall in the Saddle
description: As a girl, Kathy Ryan loved anything and everything having to do with horses. Her childhood in Brooklyn was filled with horse books and figurines, movies about horses, and calendars picturing appaloosas and palominos.

title: Mariners Sign No. 1 Pick
description: Faced with the prospect of losing the rights to Alex Rodriguez, baseball's No. 1 draft pick, the cash-tight Seattle Mariners today enticed the 18-year-old shortstop into signing by guaranteeing him a three-year major league contract.

title: Vietnam Oil Group
description: Vietnam chose a consortium led by Total S.A. to study the feasibility of building and operating the country's first oil refinery, with a capacity of about 130,000 barrels a day, the French oil company said today. Total has a 30 percent stake in the consortium. PetroVietnam owns 30 percent; the Chinese Petroleum Corporation of Taiwan owns 30 percent, and Chine Investment and Development, also from Taiwan, owns 10 percent.

title: 2 Insurers Settle on Asbestos
description: Two large insurance companies said yesterday that they had agreed to pay up to $3 billion to the Fibreboard Corporation to pay off claims of individuals who say they were harmed by the company's asbestos products.

title: Board of Education's Majority Chooses Cortines as Chancellor
description: The New York City Board of Education, divided by 4 to 3, decided yesterday to appoint Ramon C. Cortines, the former Schools Superintendent in San Francisco, as the city's next Schools Chancellor.

title: Stocks Edge Upward as Dow Gains 3.36
description: Stocks notched slight gains in light trading yesterday, with strength in utilities and telecommunications issues.

title: Air Force Drawing Flak Over 'SWAT Team' Plan
description: As part of its reorganization after the cold war, the Air Force is creating a set of quick-response wings to dispatch to world crises on a moment's notice.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: Companies

title: Patterns
description: Squeeze on Young Designers

title: New Chancellor, Old Politics
description: A divided New York City Board of Education has chosen Ramon Cortines, the former Superintendent of Schools in San Francisco, as the next Schools Chancellor. Mr. Cortines may yet win the hearts, and votes, of all seven board members, and he may yet prove to be an excellent choice. But he'll have to fight hard to dispel the cloud of mayoral politics that shadows his selection.

title: For Starters, It's Bledsoe and Mirer
description: First, Coach Tom Flores of the Seattle Seahawks learned that his starting quarterback would be a rookie, Rick Mirer of Notre Dame. Yesterday, Coach Bill Parcells of the New England Patriots conceded that his starting quarterback would be a rookie, Drew Bledsoe of Washington State.

title: Judge Jerre Williams, 77, Expert On Constitutional and Labor Law
description: Judge Jerre S. Williams, an expert on constitutional, administrative and labor law, died on Sunday at Seton Hospital in Austin, Tex., where he made his home. He was 77.

title: Hardly Like Old Times For Robinson's Trojans
description: John Robinson, the sequel, is already getting mixed reviews. He last coached the University of Southern California as far back as the Ford Administration, returned Sunday night gray around the temples and found his old offensive scheme in cobwebs. He used to have his way with the North Carolinas of the world, but the Tar Heels showed him their progress in a 31-9 season-opening defeat.

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: Debt * Associates Corp. of North America, Dallas, a unit of the Ford Motor Co., is offering $300 million of notes due in 1998 at 100 to yield 5.25 percent through First Boston. The noncallable issue is rated A-1 by Moody's Investors Service and AA- by Standard & Poor's and Duff & Phelps. * First Bank N.A., Minneapolis, a unit of First Bank System Inc., is offering $100 million of 6 percent subordinated bank notes due in 2003 at 99.094 to yield 6.12 percent through Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette. The noncallable issue is rated A-3 by Moody's and A by S.& P. and Duff & Phelps.

title: Genetic Therapy Found For Dystrophy in Mice
description: IN what is being called a major step forward in the fight against muscular dystrophy, researchers have shown that gene therapy prevents muscle destruction and loss of muscle function in mice that carry the genetic flaws that cause two forms of the disease.

title: Letitia Ide, 84, Dies; A Jose Limon Dancer
description: Letitia Ide, who performed with the Humphrey-Weidman and Jose Limon modern-dance companies in the 1930's and 40's, died on Sunday at her home in Hastings-on-Hudson, N.Y. She was 84.

title: INSIDE
description: Somalia Raid Yields Little
